reviewText: Another great workout from Powerstrike. As in other Ilaria videos, she begins with an introduction of the moves. (you can jump ahead to the work out with the improved menu--improved from Vol. 4 which was a very amateur almost useless menu which looked like it was created on a computer). It's not an interactive menu as some of the more modern DVD now use but it does have a play all feature if you choose. I always "play all".If you are familiar with Ilaria's Powerstrike or Bodystrikes video you'll know that all of her choreographies build up from previous moves, from easy to more complex, from "lighter" to more intensity. All choreographies are low impact but very high intensity. She always gives instructions on how to do and how not to do a move. And she gives options, that is if you need to modify a move because you are just beginning or are new to the program.Her voice is as usual pleasing to the ear and encouraging enough to keep you motivated. The music is fast paced and also pleasant, in balance with her voice (i.e., she doesn't have to scream over the music). What is different in this video is that in the warmup exercises (and they are all long warm ups prior to the routines) she works both sides of the body using different routines. In previous workouts, we simply mirror image the routine to work both sides of the body. this might be a good thing if you feel you'll easily be bored with doing the same routine on both sides of the body. The important thing is that you equally work both sides of the body.This very long warm up is to get the moves down, to understand them before doing the routines. I must admit that the punching segment is a tad confusing but that is what boxing is about--coordination. You might have to think a little bit about it. I know I did. What I did to get through this and understand the punches was to slow down the punches just a tad or work at 80% intensity so that I could understand what the heck I was doing. It's really weird to jab, cross, hook, cross, uppercut, cross at such a pace and then incorporating fast punches (jab-jab-cross). I don't have a boxing or extensive kickboxing background that this was just weird to get used to.I want to say that Powerstrike vol 6 incorporates a slip into the boxing/punching warmup--that too takes come coordinating if you are not used to these moves and at such speed. Although I must say that I remember early Tae Bo and that stuff was REALLY fast. Too fast for me that it hurt to perform some of the Tae Bo exercises (knees and elbows in particular). I have not have the same discomfort with the moderately fast Powerstrike DVDs.I wouldn't let this complexity deter me from performing the workout or at least checking out the DVD at a library or at least on You tube. I may never have to use these moves exactly in real life or a boxing ring but I must say the punches portion gets my heart moving. It's a bit of a break when we incorporate the kicking--sort of break you will still sweat like a horse.I cannot say enough wonderful things about the powerstrike DVDs w/o sounding like a paid commercial; but I must say that there is a reason I love kickboxing DVDs so much. I'm working out my abs almost w/o knowing it. The twisting in the upper body really gives me a waistline in no time. It beats doing crunches. If you have any doubts about this DVD check out youtube or totalfitnessdvds.com for portions of the workouts. Ilaria's DVDs are pricier than some other workout dvds I bought at amazon. For me, I love everything about Powerstrike vol 5.
summary: Same format and style just a little different
Title: N/A

reviewText: For the past few years I've been slowly moving up my workout intensity from Walk-at-Home to this. I wasn't sure if I would like Powerstrike but I love it. The combinations can be a bit tricky if you are new to the workout. But, I managed to keep up. It was an amazing workout and I really enjoyed it. It is definitely one of my new favorites! I have most of the new Tae Bo series and I think I might prefer this. It has a little faster pace and no preaching (like Billy Blanks tend to do!). A great way to get your heart rate up!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I consider myself at an intermediate level of fitness.This is similar to Powerstrike4 with a strong karate base for the moves.  Organized, well-cued, minimal music, same set of instructors, same workout structure.In the end, there are only so many ways to mix up punches and kicks so having something fresh each time is tough.  That said, it would have been nice to see one or two moves that are a bit different mixed in this one that made it stand out from the other Powerstrike workouts.That said, still a very solid workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love Turbo Jam kick boxing, but this one really is wonderful in its own right.  I've tried almost all of the PowerStrike kick boxing workouts at one time or another (most are now unavailable unfortunately) and this one is my favorite.  The older PS workouts have you do all of the punching and kicking on one side before going to the 2nd side...it's extremely tiring.But this one, Ilaria changed it up so that you switch sides fairly frequently and therefore you don't get quite so tired!Chapter breakdown:IntroWarmup and Punches - 13 minutesKicks - 10 minutesCombos, Blocks, and Cooldown - 25 minutesThe chaptering could have been a smidge better near the end (separate chapter points for blocks and cooldown) but I didn't mind too much.Very fun, drill-style workout that I enjoyed so much I'm giving PS 4 another shot!I hope Ilaria continues to put out great kick boxing workouts like PS5!
summary: One of my favorite all time kickboxing workouts!

reviewText: This is the 3rd DVD of Ilaria's that I have and she is the best!  What a wonderful and effective workout.  She is a very knowledgeable and personable instructor (with an amazing physique) which makes this workout very doable.  I can't wait for more of her workouts to become available, because they are all so good!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love Ilaria Montagnani's workouts. I also have a martial arts background, and I can say that she definitely knows her stuff (martial arts-wise). Ilaria offers a fast-paced, vigorous, form-conscious kickboxing workout here. I haven't tried her previous Powerstrike workouts, but I'm sure this one is the best one yet. She keeps things moving and tests your coordination with fast punch and kick combos, and although it may take several tries to be able to be spot-on with Ilaria and the rest of her crew, it's something to work towards. It can also easily be done in limited space, and for those who live in upper-level apartments or dwellings, it won't cause neighbors below to complain...it's all low-impact, with no vigorous jumping involved or joint-jarring movements. Only good body mechanics is encouraged throughout the workout, something I've found sorely lacking in many other popular workouts (i.e. Jillian Michaels, who claims to be a kickboxing aficionado; but I'm sure Ilaria is 10 times tougher while being 10 times more humble at the same time). Although plyometrics are often inserted in kickboxing workouts for extra calorie-burn and cardiovascular challenge, this workout is challenging enough without plyometrics and is based purely on good technique. If you are as technique-conscious as Ilaria and her crew, you will definitely burn calories by the end too. A few complaints were the fact that the music (which is aptly timed to all the movements and is contemporary techno-based, though can be annoying to some peoples' tastes) is actually louder than her voice, so one may not adequately hear Ilaria's cuing before the next combination begins. However, with practice, one can get used to the pace and know what to expect next. Ilaria is professional, mature, soft-spoken, easy-going, non-intimidating (although her physique is truly "shredded"...take that, Jillian!), and an overall high-quality instructor of proper form and technique. If you push yourself to achieve full extension in the kicks and precision/aim in your punches, you will work up an amazing sweat. It's almost like dancing, with kickboxing choreography. I highly recommend all of Ilaria's standing workouts for an excellent low-impact alternative that is nevertheless cutting-edge, challenging, economical (with regard to space and time, since you can do so much in 50 minutes in a relatively small area), and highly cardiovascular. Highly recommended.
summary: Professionally-executed, complex, vigorous, yet low-impact workout...
Title: N/A

reviewText: We have Ilaria's Sword workout and really enjoy it so we thought we'd give this a try.  We're used to doing Tae Bo so we knew we could do the type of exercise on the DVD.  We do like it alot and it's fast paced.  (No real "walk it outs" like you'd find in Tae Bo)  The 'add on's' get a little out of hand though.  We're not dancers so memorizing a bunch of punching combos with up to 10 moves comprising one overall repeated set gets somewhat daunting.  They do the same with kicks too.  If you don't like a lot of choreography then you might not care for this one.  But as far as being a good overall kickboxing workout, it's a winner.(Also, while the DVD menu is improved over the Sword workout as it's broken up into chapters now, it's still flawed.  If you hit play all, it includes the long introduction to the moves.  If you try to skip it, it only plays each section.  One day her editor will get it right!)  More an irritant than a deterrent.
Title: N/A

reviewText: In my opinion, this is the BEST kickboxing DVD out there. It's a must have. Powerstrike 5 is about 52 min. long but time really flies. Don't skip the introduction the first few tries because Ilaria demonstrates the proper execution of the punches and kicks. I'm a bit challenged to execute the moves because they're different from what I'm used to from doing Tae Bo and Turbo Jam for years. I have to admit that I prefer my 1/2 hr. cardio interval dvds but once you get going with this one, you're gonna love it. It's just so worth of my time. I don't have to pound my knees to feel worked out that's why I chose this over Cathe's HIIT for an effective cardio dvd. I know Cathe's HIIT is great and may just be 1/2 hr long but I'm 45 years old and I'd like to take care of my knees/joints from all the jumping. 20 min. into Ilaria's routine and I was sweating buckets. The combinations are a bit challenging but Ilaria is such a great instructor that I know I'll have the moves down after few more tries. Why didn't I find her before I wasted learning sloppy moves with Tae Bo? I have Turbo Jam also and I have fun doing it. However, I don't feel challenged anymore. I'll do Turbo Jam on days that I don't feel like working out or so you call on light cardio days. No offense to anyone who loves Tae Bo but I think I'll donate my Tae Bo dvds to make room for more Ilaria's dvds in the future. I highly recommend this dvd and I'm so glad I invested $20 on this one.
summary: Excellent Hight Intensity/Low Impact workout DVD
